title: ecoevo.social-docs
text:
Rules to respect, etiquette, and general things to know about the ecoevo.social server and Mastodon in general.
ecoevo.social is a Mastodon server dedicated to the biological Ecology and Evolution community. This is broadly defined; everyone who is connected to those topics is welcome.
ecoevo.social is administered by Alexis Simon. This is volunteer work, and as such there may occasionally be some issues along the road that are not resolved immediately. Please be patient if issues arise, as we are all learning together how to best develop this community and space.
If you are in a position to do so, you can contribute financially for the maintenance of the server through Open Collective.
Enjoy connecting!


A safe internet user is an informed internet user.
The privacy policy indicates what will be enforced regarding privacy.






Important considerations about privacy



Posts on Mastodon are not end-to-end encrypted. Do not share any sensitive information over Mastodon. For more details, see the privacy policy.
You must be aware that Mastodon data, both public and direct messages, are accessible by server operators and receiving servers (for example if you send a direct message to someone on another server).
Quoted from the privacy policy:

We may also release your information when we believe release is appropriate to comply with the law, enforce our site policies, or protect our or others’ rights, property, or safety.

If you need to have truly private conversations with someone else that contain sensitive information, we suggest you use another application offering end-to-end encryption and privacy. One good option is Signal.





Mastodon is a federated microblogging platform. You can read more about it in its documentation.

title: 2  Rules
text:
No racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, or casteism
No incitement of violence or promotion of violent ideologies
No harassment, dogpiling, or doxxing of other users
No intentional sharing of false or misleading information
No posting of sexually explicit or violent media
No content that is considered illegal in France and/or Germany

This set of rules has been copied from the mastodon.social instance. They are not set in stone and community-suggested changes in wording or the addition of rules is welcomed. See the section How to contribute.

title: 3  Etiquette
text:
Content Warnings (CW) are useful to:

protect people sensitive to a given subject from being unwillingly exposed to it,
keep subjects that may not interest everyone as an opt-in option, and/or
keep timelines easier to read.

Content Warnings should be used for topics including, but not limited to:

Triggering content

reports or news about sexual assault, harassment, violence, racism, antisemitism, LGBTQIA+-phobia, burnout, etc.

Glorification of over-working
Politics
Job postings: you can use the subject area as you would in an email Subject

title: 3  Etiquette
text:
3.2 Describe the media you post
Written descriptions of photos and videos you post are a really important way to increase the accessibility of Mastodon for visually impaired people.
When posting media (pictures or videos), click the edit button and a window will allow you to enter a short written description. This is sometimes also referred to as “alt text” or “alternative text”.

title: 3  Etiquette
text:
3.3 Use of hashtags
Hashtags are how content from users you do not follow can be discovered on Mastodon, since the text content of toots is generally not searchable (in most cases anyway; in all cases it requires additional algorithms/software/infrastructure to do so).
Given that consideration, we encourage the use of hashtags to classify and broaden the potential reach of the content you share.
Hashtags should use the CamelCase format, where words are separated by upper cases, like so: #ThisNewHashtagIsGreat. This can aid in their readability both by people and by screen readers.
A list of hashtags that could be used on ecoevo.social:

#JobOffer when posting a job offer of any kind, add more hashtags to precise level #TenureTrack, #Postdoc, #GraduateStudent, #Technician, etc. and subjects #Ecology, #Labwork, #Modeling, etc.
#Internship to advertise an internship, precise subjects similar to job offers
#Conference to advertise a conference
#Preprint, #JournalArticle, etc. for new research results
#rstats or #python or other languages for coding questions or resources

title: 3  Etiquette
text:
3.4 Threads
When posting a thread:

Set your first toot to be Public (visible for all)
Then, reply to your first toot and set the visibility to Unlisted (visible for all, but opted-out of discovery features)
Continue your thread and the visibility will be automatically continue to be set as Unlisted unless you change it

It is considerate to use the i/n indication at the end of your toots to better indicate this is a thread, where i is the number of the current toot in the thread and n is the total number of toots. You can keep it as a literal n if you don’t know the total number of toots). This approach is similar to the convention people use at the bird site.

title: 4  Contributing
text:
This documentation is being developed as a Quarto book hosted on GitHub.
To contribute, head to the GitHub repository and open either:

an issue
a pull-request
or start a discussion

Documents are written in markdown, with each section in its respective ./*.qmd document.

title: 4  Contributing
text:
4.2 Contributing financially to server costs
If you would like to contribute financially to server hosting costs, head to Open Collective. The budget is fully transparent there. Transactions are made using Wise.
While this is not currently the case, if more money than necessary to operate the server and renew the domain name is collected, any additional funds will be redistributed to the community. This redistribution could occur in a number of possible ways, including via possible initiatives like a “best student science communication toot” competition/prize.

title: 4  Contributing
text:
4.3 Contributing to server moderation
If you want to help protect people using this instance from internal and/or external misbehaviors, you can ask me, Alexis Simon, to help contribute to moderating.
To do so, send a direct message via @alxsim@ecoevo.social and we can chat.
